FuncDef: To configure traffic policing for a class map in a policy map, use the police command.
CLIs: police [ cir ] { <committed-rate> [ <data-rate> ] | percent <cir-link-percent> } [ bc ] { <committed-burst-rate> }] [ conform { transmit } [ violate { drop }]]]
no police [ cir ] { <committed-rate> [ <data-rate> ] | percent <cir-link-percent> } [ bc ] { <committed-burst-rate> }] [ conform { transmit } [ violate { drop }]]]

ParaDef.Info: (Optional) Specifies the committed information rate, or desired bandwidth, specified as a bit rate or a percentage of the link rate.
Valid values are: bps (default) kbps mbps Gbps
Specifies the rate as a percentage of the interface data rate.
Percentage of the interface data rate. Valid values are from 1 to 100.

(Optional) Indication of how much the committed information rate can be exceeded, either as a bit rate or an amount of time at the committed information rate. The default value is 200 milliseconds of traffic at the configured rate.

Valid values of committed-burst-rate are: bytes - Bytes kbytes - 1000 bytes mbytes - 1,000,000 bytes ms - milliseconds us - microseconds The valid range is 1 to 536,870,912. Note The Gigabit per second (Gbps) rate is not supported for this parameter.
(Optional) Specifies a comform action to take if the traffic data rate is within bounds. The default action is transmit .
Transmits the packet. This is available only when the packet conforms to the parameters.
(Optional) Specifies the action to take if the traffic data rate violates the configured rate values. The default action is drop .
Drops the packet. This is available only when the packet exceeds or violates the parameters.

Examples: switch(config-pmap-c-qos)# police cir 80 mbps bc 20 mbytes conform transmit violate drop
switch(config-pmap-c-qos)# police cir percent 10 bc 20 mbytes conform transmit violate drop
ExtraInfo:
You must create the class map before you reference it in this command.
Command Default:None
msg: Error CLI:police [ cir ] { <committed-rate> [ <data-rate> ] | percent <cir-link-percent> } [ bc ] { <committed-burst-rate> }] [ conform { transmit } [ violate { drop }]]]
Error CLI:no police [ cir ] { <committed-rate> [ <data-rate> ] | percent <cir-link-percent> } [ bc ] { <committed-burst-rate> }] [ conform { transmit } [ violate { drop }]]]
